{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3417562,"name":"Ian McTavish","username":"Ian_McTavish","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/b5a626/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-08-23T13:19:09.598Z","cooked":"

I’ve created this featurescript to help speed up the process of creating mounting holes in onShape for electronics. My hope is that creating belly pan layouts can be done fairly quickly.
Documentation can be found here.
The link to the OnShape document is here.
If you find it useful or have suggestions please let me know!

Electrical Components Placer960×540 84.2 KB

What benefit does this provide over Julia’s Electronics Mounting FS? Notably, your FS lacks the ability to override hole diameter - which is useful when you may want to install a component onto a tapped part and is also missing the ability to select a reference edge for component clocking.

To be honest I hadn’t seen Julia’s - so I basically reinvented the wheel. Having said that I’ve found using the grid featurescript and then the components one really speeds up the process for laying items out. I do have upgrades planned including the two abilities you mentioned. My other goal is to learn FeatureScript so I can more easily create tools that are useful to myself and my team. Julia’s scripts are a tremendous resource and I do need to spend some time revisiting what is there.
